Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Quizzical \Quiz"zic*al\ (kw[i^]z"z[i^]*kal), a. Relating to quizzing; given to quizzing; of the nature of a quiz; farcical; sportive. [1913 Webster] -- {Quiz"zic*al*ly}, adv. [1913 Webster]

quizzical adj 1: playfully vexing (especially by ridicule); "his face wore a somewhat quizzical almost impertinent air"- Lawrence Durrell [syn: {mocking}, {teasing}] 2: perplexed (as if being expected to know something that you do not know); "he had a quizzical expression" [syn: {questioning}]
